Seeds in the Ground

Community-led initiatives taking root and flourishing

These are the living examples of regenerative innovation in action. Each project represents a partnership with communities to grow solutions they own and control. From storytelling platforms to land regeneration, these initiatives demonstrate what's possible when communities lead their own change.

"Every story is a seed. Every seed is a possibility. Every possibility is a future we cultivate together." â—†

Seeds Currently Growing

Each initiative follows our Listen â†’ Curiosity â†’ Action â†’ Art methodology, ensuring community voices lead from conception to implementation. We tend the conditions; communities grow the solutions.

Loading seeds in the ground...

How Seeds Become Forests

Every project moves through distinct growing phases, always maintaining community ownership and self-determination at the center. Like regenerative farming, we work with natural cycles.

ðŸŒ°

1. Seeds: Deep Listening

Preparing the soil through relationship

Community-identified challenges and opportunities. We listen to understand existing knowledge systems, cultural protocols, and community-defined success metrics. Your experience is the soil from which solutions grow.

  • Community consultation & elder meetings
  • Cultural protocol learning
  • Asset mapping with communities
  • Understanding what soil we're working with
â—†

2. Sprouting: Co-Design

Choosing the right seeds for the season

Working together to frame challenges as opportunities and develop community-owned solutions. Traditional knowledge meets innovative tools. Let's explore this togetherâ€”the best learning happens when we all get our hands dirty.

  • Design workshops & prototype development
  • Community feedback cycles
  • Resource planning with ownership models
  • Testing what wants to grow
â—¯

3. Growing: Building Capacity

Tending the garden as it takes root

Building tools and systems while simultaneously building community capacity to own and operate them. Everything designed for community control. We've prepared the soil, planted the seedsâ€”now we cultivate revolution.

  • Platform development with community ownership
  • Training programs & local leadership development
  • System testing & iteration
  • Transferring the keys gradually
ðŸŒ³

4. Thriving: Community Ownership

Celebrating the harvest together

Communities fully own and operate their tools. Our role shifts to peer support and connecting communities with similar challenges. Look what we've grown together! Every harvest feeds the whole community.

  • Full community control & governance
  • Peer network facilitation
  • Knowledge sharing between communities
  • Joy impact assessments

Have a Seed to Plant?

We're always listening for community-led initiatives that align with regenerative innovation. Share your ideaâ€”even if it's just a seed of possibility. Every story is a seed, and we'd love to help yours grow.

Plant Your Seed

We'll get back to you within a few days to continue the conversation and see how we can tend the conditions for growth.

Our Collective Harvest

When communities control their own tools and narratives, the ripple effects extend far beyond individual projects. This is what regenerative innovation looks like when it scales through networks, not extraction.
